description.S1: You found a suspicious data cartridge.
description.S2: This may be what Zora was looking for.

blurb.B1: Return to Zora for your reward of Iconoclasts Reputation and 15000 XP, 750 Bit Cartridges.
blurb.B2: You'll learn Graham gave them the gate codes, and orchestrated the attack.
blurb.B3: You can confront him after this and he will allude to a "lesser man than he is now" having made such a call, and tell you that the ends justify the means.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I found a box of data cartridges.

dialog.speaker: Zora (Female)
dialog.utterance: Let's see. These are old. Looks like correspondences between the pirates. Some bits here, some there, some... wait.

dialog.speaker: Zora (Female)
dialog.utterance: This... this one's got the Amber Heights gate code on it. Just like the one I found earlier. And here's... a letter? Wait, this is from Graham. Oh, of all the...

dialog.speaker: Zora (Female)
dialog.utterance: Captain, he gave them the gate codes.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Graham isn't exactly known for his rationality.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: He must have needed to take out the executives.

dialog.speaker: Zora (Female)
dialog.utterance: Yeah. He did. He really did.

dialog.speaker: Zora (Female)
dialog.utterance: I know he's got his head in the clouds, but I always believed there was a core of good there. What the hell happened to live and let live?

dialog.speaker: Zora (Female)
dialog.utterance: Thank you for bringing this back, but I need some time. I gotta think. I'll let you know if I figure something out.

dialog.speaker: Zora (Female)
dialog.utterance: Watch it. That's our leader you're talking about. My friend.

dialog.speaker: Zora (Female)
dialog.utterance: And their families? And all the hired help?
